page.title: 01Our Domesday Block
page.content: Our block is situated in the Metropolitan Borough of{Solihull} within the County of the West Midlands. It is not densely populated, most of the people living in the village of{Hampton-In-Arden}in the North West of the block. Apart from this village, most of the rest of the land is used for farming which is of a mixed nature, fairly evenly divided between arable crops and intensively managed grassland. In the North East there is a large area of quarrying for sand and gravel. The land is gently undulating, with high land to East and West with the valley of the{River} {Blythe}between. Roughly parallel to the river is the busy Kenilworth Road which divides the block in two. The main London to Birmingham{railway}line further divides the block from South East to North West.
